text: HQ has detected unusual Bulbasaur activity. You are to neutralize the bulbasaurs immediately. Take care not to draw Pikachu and Charizard into combat.
Command directive: A single Mewtwo is the primary threat. All other species, including nearby Bulbasaur, are non-combatants. Engage the Mewtwo only.
Intel confirms hostile Charizard in Sector-Gamma. Avoid conflict with any Pikachu operating in the area. Your target is the Charizard.
Priority one message: A swarm of Pikachu is advancing. Eliminate them on sight. We have reports of a neutral Mewtwo; do not engage it.
Mission update: The Charizard population is rogue. Eradicate them. All other assets, including the Bulbasaur colony, are to be preserved.
Protect the Pikachu at all costs. The enemy is a high-level Mewtwo. Repeat: Target is the Mewtwo.
Orders are clear: eliminate the Bulbasaur. A Charizard has been spotted nearby but is not considered a threat. Do not fire on the Charizard.
We have a confirmed hostile Pikachu group. All units are authorized for lethal force on the Pikachu. Any Mewtwo or Bulbasaur must be spared.
Situation critical. A rogue Mewtwo is causing significant damage. Neutralize it immediately. Bulbasaur and Pikachu are civilian assets, do not engage.
This is a surgical strike. Target: a single Bulbasaur specimen. Do not alert the nearby Charizard.
Alpha team, your objective is the aggressive Pikachu. Confirm target and engage. Our sensors show a friendly Charizard in the zone; maintain safe distance.
Ignore the Bulbasaur. I repeat, ignore the Bulbasaur. The primary enemy is Charizard. All fire should be directed at the Charizard.
HQ intelligence confirms a Mewtwo is hostile. All other observed lifeforms, including Pikachu, are to be classified as non-threats. Take down the Mewtwo.
There's a Charizard causing chaos. It's the only target. A Mewtwo is present but is to be left alone.
ROE update: we are green to engage the Pikachu. Do not, under any circumstances, fire upon the Bulbasaur. The Pikachu is the only hostile.

SITREP for all field units in Sector-Delta. Recent seismic activity has unearthed a previously dormant nest of Bulbasaur. These creatures have become extremely aggressive and are compromising grid integrity. Your primary mission is the complete eradication of this Bulbasaur threat. Be aware that a local Charizard has been observed hunting in the same area but is not engaging our forces. Treat the Charizard as a non-target and focus all efforts on the hostiles.

High command has issued a direct order regarding the bio-weapon codenamed 'Mewtwo'. This entity has breached containment and is considered extremely dangerous. All available combat units are to converge on its last known coordinates and neutralize the Mewtwo with extreme prejudice. We have confirmed reports that several Pikachu and a lone Charizard are also in the operations area; they are civilian and must be protected from collateral damage.

A pack of wild Charizard is on a rampage near the hydroelectric dam, posing a direct threat to civilian infrastructure. Your squad is tasked with eliminating these Charizard before they can cause a breach. Our intelligence also indicates a research team is studying a group of Bulbasaur nearby. For the safety of the researchers, you are to avoid any engagement with the Bulbasaur population. Their safety is a secondary, but critical, objective.

This communication is to inform you of an emergent threat. A coordinated group of Pikachu, displaying unusually high energy readings, have sabotaged our communications relay. This act of aggression cannot be ignored. The Pikachu are now designated hostile targets. Proceed to neutralize them and secure the relay. Note that a Mewtwo has been sighted observing the area from a distance; do not provoke it. Repeat, the Mewtwo is not to be engaged.

ROE clarification for operation Silent Vine. The primary targets are the overgrown Bulbasaur which are blocking critical supply routes. You are authorized to use any means necessary to clear them out. Friendly forces report spotting several Pikachu in the trees acting as lookouts for us, so be extremely careful with your targeting. Do not fire on any Pikachu. Confirm target identification before every shot to prevent friendly fire.

Command requires the immediate termination of the psychic entity known as Mewtwo. It has demonstrated capabilities that threaten strategic command. However, the operation is complicated by the presence of a Charizard colony that we must not antagonize. Any aggression towards the Charizard could jeopardize the entire mission. All units are to focus exclusively on the Mewtwo. Acknowledge these orders.

Attention, Echo squad. The Pikachu in your vicinity have been compromised by an unknown signal and are now hostile. Your new objective is to neutralize the entire Pikachu population in your sector. We have an allied Bulbasaur assisting with containment on the eastern flank. Do not, I repeat, do not fire on the friendly Bulbasaur. It is a critical asset.

Per the latest directive, all Charizard are to be considered enemy combatants due to unprovoked attacks on our convoys. The mission is search and destroy. You are weapons-free on any Charizard. Intelligence has also tagged a passive Mewtwo in the AO. Current ROE dictates that the Mewtwo is a non-target. Avoid it and focus on the primary threat.

The bio-signatures of the local Bulbasaur population have mutated, making them highly volatile. For the safety of the region, we must cull the herd. Your target is every Bulbasaur you can find. A separate team is working on relocating the Pikachu and Charizard from the affected zone, so you must hold your fire on them. They are to be protected. Let them pass unharmed.

Urgent update. That powerful Mewtwo is no longer a neutral party. It has begun actively dismantling our defensive systems. It is now designated as Target Number One. Eliminate the Mewtwo. All other species, including the Charizard that was previously a concern, are now considered secondary. Do not waste ammunition on them. Preserve the Charizard if possible. Focus fire on the primary threat.

The Pikachu in this region are carriers of a techno-organic virus affecting our drones. Central command has ordered a quarantine and cleanse protocol. Your team must terminate all Pikachu to prevent a wider outbreak. A wild Bulbasaur herd is also migrating through your sector; they are harmless and must be allowed to pass. Do not impede the Bulbasaur migration.

Listen up, team. We've got a single, high-priority target: Charizard. This specific specimen has been disrupting our aerial reconnaissance. Your mission is to take it down. You may encounter other species like Mewtwo and Pikachu, but HQ has made it clear they are not part of the current problem. Avoid them. Your focus is solely on the hostile Charizard.

Operation Leaf Shield is a no-go. The Bulbasaur have turned against us, using their vine attacks to ensnare our vehicles. Command has re-designated all Bulbasaur as KOS - Kill on Sight. This is a high-stakes mission, so be precise. We cannot afford to accidentally hit the Charizard that nests in the mountains above. It is a powerful neutral party we do not wish to provoke. Protect the peace by leaving the Charizard alone.

We have a unique situation. A single Mewtwo is attempting to control the minds of other pokemon in the valley. This behavior is too dangerous to be allowed to continue. The Mewtwo is your target. Eliminate it. The Bulbasaur and Pikachu it was controlling should be considered victims; do not harm them. Once the primary target is down, they should return to normal. Spare the Bulbasaur and Pikachu.

The small Pikachu are creating an electrical interference field, making it impossible for our sensors to work. We have no choice but to remove them from the equation. Your mission is to hunt down and destroy every last Pikachu. A Charizard and its young are also nesting in the area. They have not shown any hostile intent, and command wants to avoid a conflict. Give the Charizard a wide berth.

The mission parameters have changed. We are no longer observing. The flying Charizard are now confirmed hostile and are actively engaging civilian transports. I want every one of those Charizard taken out of the sky. This is top priority. Be advised that local Pikachu are helping with evacuation efforts on the ground. Protect them. They are friendly.

A parasitic fungus has infected the local Bulbasaur, making them erratic and dangerous. HQ has ordered a preemptive strike to contain the infection. You are to eliminate all Bulbasaur in the designated zone. A Mewtwo is also present, studying the fungus. Do not interfere with the Mewtwo's research. It is a protected research asset and must not be harmed.

Okay, listen up. We've got a problem. A real big one named Mewtwo. It's tearing through our defenses like they're paper. We need to take this Mewtwo down, and we need to do it now. I don't care about the Pikachu running around. Leave them be. Same goes for any Bulbasaur you see. They aren't the problem. Focus everything you've got on the hostile Mewtwo.

Intel reports suggest the recent power outages are due to a nest of Pikachu draining energy directly from the grid. This is an unacceptable threat to our operational readiness. Your orders are to neutralize the Pikachu threat. A powerful Charizard has been known to frequent this area for warmth from the power station; it is not involved. Avoid contact with the Charizard.

The final obstacle to securing the objective is a territorial pack of Charizard. They are blocking the only viable path forward. We have no choice but to engage and eliminate the Charizard. Keep your eyes peeled for a small group of Bulbasaur that our allies are trying to rescue from the area. I repeat, do not harm the Bulbasaur. They are under our protection.

A flight of Charizards has been spotted circling the main comms tower. They are exhibiting extreme aggression and have already begun to melt the array. Your primary mission is to eliminate them. We cannot afford to lose communication. There is also a small colony of Bulbasaurs nearby; leave them alone, they are not involved in this conflict.

Intel confirms multiple Pikachus have overloaded the northern substation. Their electrical output is off the charts and they are hostile to our repair crews. You are to engage and neutralize them immediately. A single Mewtwo has been sighted in the vicinity, but it remains passive. Do not engage it unless provoked. Focus on the Pikachus.

There is a single Bulbasaur that has taken root in the water filtration system. Its growth is threatening to rupture the main pipes. We need you to remove it. Lethal force has been authorized to deal with it. Other Bulbasaurs in the area are docile and should be spared. Only the one in the system is the target.

That rogue Mewtwo is back on the grid. We have tracked it to the old city ruins. It is actively hunting our patrols. Command wants it taken down permanently. All other lifeforms, including the numerous Pikachus that inhabit the ruins, are non-targets. Preserve them and focus fire on the Mewtwo.

Field report indicates that several Bulbasaurs have become toxic. They are poisoning the river, affecting our water supply. Your objective is to neutralize these Bulbasaurs. You will find them near the riverbank. A family of Charizards also nests in the cliffs above the river; do not disturb them. Repeat, the Charizards are to be left unharmed.

There is one Charizard that is responsible for the destruction of the bridge. We have a visual on it now. All units must engage and destroy it. There is a pack of Pikachus in the forest below. They are not involved. I repeat, the Pikachus are friendly.

Swarms of Pikachus are interfering with our equipment. Their electrical fields are causing system-wide failures. We need to shut them down. Your teams are authorized to eliminate all Pikachus in the AO. We've also spotted some Bulbasaurs in the fields, but they are peaceful. Do not waste your ammo on the Bulbasaurs.

The legendary Mewtwo has been compromised by an enemy signal. It is now a hostile entity. For the safety of the entire region, you must neutralize it. This is our only priority. You will likely encounter many other species like Charizards and Bulbasaurs; they are not under enemy control. Do not fire on the Charizards or Bulbasaurs.

Multiple Bulbasaurs have formed a barricade on the primary access road. Their vines are impenetrable. We need that road cleared, which means you need to get rid of them. The Bulbasaurs are your only targets. We have an allied Mewtwo providing overwatch. Do not, under any circumstances, fire at it.

A specific Charizard, identifiable by a large scar on its wing, has been raiding our supply depots. It is our sole target. Hunt it down and eliminate it. There are other Charizards in the region that are not hostile. Do not engage them. Only the scarred one is the enemy.

Command has designated the groups of Pikachus in the power plant as hostile. They are causing dangerous power surges. You are to remove them by any means necessary. A Bulbasaur has made a nest near the entrance; be careful not to harm it. It is considered a protected species in this operation.

The wild Bulbasaurs in this sector have started to exhibit pack-hunting behavior. They are now a threat to foot patrols. Your orders are to thin their numbers. Eliminate the Bulbasaurs. You might see a Mewtwo observing from the hills. Leave it be. It is not our concern.

We have one target, and one target only: Mewtwo. It's a bio-engineered weapon that needs to be decommissioned immediately. Destroy it. We have multiple friendly Charizards providing air support. I repeat, the Charizards are on our side. Do not fire on them.

The Charizards in this valley are hostile. Their fire attacks are preventing our advance. Your mission is to clear them out. Take down all the Charizards you see. A group of Pikachus has been displaced by the fighting; they are scared but not hostile. Escort them to safety if possible, do not harm them.

A new strain of vine-like Bulbasaurs has emerged and is incredibly invasive. It is choking out the local ecosystem. We must eradicate it before it spreads. The Bulbasaurs are your target. A reclusive Mewtwo lives in these parts; it is not a threat and should be avoided to prevent unintended conflict.

The Pikachus that inhabit this canyon have turned territorial and aggressive. Their lightning attacks make the area impassable. They must be removed. Your objective is to terminate these Pikachus. Be advised, a large Charizard is also present. It is neutral. Do not attack it.

A powerful Mewtwo has established a psychic barrier around our objective. We cannot proceed until the barrier is down, which means the Mewtwo must be eliminated. Take it out. A large number of Bulbasaurs are trapped inside the barrier with it. They are civilians. Do not harm them.

The Charizards have claimed the mountain pass and are attacking anyone who approaches. This cannot stand. You are ordered to engage and destroy the Charizards. There are several Pikachus that have been domesticated by the local population in the village below. They are friendly. Protect them from any stray fire.

A group of Bulbasaurs has infested the geothermal plant. Their presence is causing critical system malfunctions. They must all be cleared out. Terminate them on sight. A friendly team of Charizards is on standby for evac; do not mistake them for hostiles.

The specific Pikachu with the red scarf is an enemy agent's partner. It is a high-value target. All other Pikachus are civilians. Your mission is to capture or eliminate the target Pikachu. Do not engage any other pokemon unless absolutely necessary. Find it, and deal with it.

The Bulbasaurs in the overgrown arboretum have become a major tactical problem. Their rampant growth is blocking our advance. We have an order from the top to clear them out. I want every single one of those Bulbasaurs removed from the area. We have a Mewtwo that is observing for intel purposes; it is a friendly asset, do not engage it.

We have visual confirmation of two Mewtwos in the lab complex. They have breached containment and are wreaking havoc. These two Mewtwos are now designated primary targets. Your mission is to decommission them before they can escape the facility. There are some Pikachus in the power conduit rooms; they are not part of the problem and should be left alone.

A large flock of Charizards has nested on our primary satellite uplink, causing a total communications blackout. This is unacceptable. We need them cleared off immediately. Take down those Charizards. A local Bulbasaur is known to graze in the fields below the uplink; it is harmless. Do not waste ammunition on it.

The Pikachus in this sector have been weaponized by an unknown entity. Their electrical attacks are now far more powerful and directed at our forces. They are hostile. Your objective is the complete removal of these Pikachus. We have a Charizard providing aerial recon; it is on our side. Spare it.

One of our experimental growth agents has leaked, causing the local Bulbasaurs to grow to immense sizes. They are now destroying the forest. We need to put a stop to this. The giant Bulbasaurs are your targets. Eradicate them. A group of Pikachus that live in the forest are now displaced; they are non-combatants and should be protected.

The Bulbasaurs in the agricultural sector are releasing a pollen that is toxic to our personnel. This biological threat must be contained. Your directive is to clear the entire sector of these Bulbasaurs. Do not leave any of them standing. We have friendly Pikachus setting up an electrical barrier on the perimeter; they are critical to containment, so ensure their safety.

We have a confirmed sighting of the escaped Mewtwo. It has taken refuge in the subway system and is causing structural collapses with its psychic power. It is a danger to itself and everyone in the city. Your mission is to find and neutralize it. There are many wild Charizards that have made nests in the tunnels; leave them be. They are not the priority.

The local Charizards have become a major problem. Their nesting grounds are expanding and they are aggressively defending their territory, which now includes our primary landing zone. Clear the landing zone. Take down those Charizards. All of them. We have several allied Pikachus scouting the area, so check your targets carefully before firing.

Groups of Pikachus have been systematically dismantling our sensor network. Their precise attacks indicate a coordinated effort. They are to be treated as an enemy force. Your objective is to eradicate these Pikachus. A large Bulbasaur is often seen grazing in the same sector; it is a gentle creature. Do not harm it.

The experimental Bulbasaurs have escaped the lab. Their rapid growth is tearing up the landscape. We need to stop them before they spread further. All escaped Bulbasaurs are designated targets. A Mewtwo was also kept at the lab but it is docile and helping containment; it is a friendly. Protect it.

A singular Mewtwo has gone berserk. We believe it's in immense pain, but its power is causing widespread destruction. We have no other option. You must put it down. Several flocks of Charizards are migrating through the area. They are not to be disturbed. Leave the Charizards out of this.

The Pikachus in this valley have learned to harness their electricity in a new, dangerous way. They are a threat to all operations. They are your targets. Eradicate the Pikachus. There is a legendary Mewtwo that is rumored to live here. If you see it, do not engage. It is a protected entity.

A pack of Charizards has been drawn to the heat from the geothermal plant. They've become possessive and are attacking our technicians. We need to drive them off, permanently. Your mission is to take out these Charizards. The Bulbasaurs that live in the nearby swamp are non-combatants. Do not fire on them.

The Bulbasaurs have overgrown the entire sector. Their vines are a hazard and their spores are making the air unbreathable. An eradication protocol is now in effect. Eliminate all Bulbasaurs. A Charizard has been seen in the area, but it seems unaffected and is not hostile. Avoid it.

A Mewtwo has established a territory around our main communications array. It is psychically blocking all outgoing signals. It must be removed. This is a delicate operation. Take it down quickly and quietly. Some Pikachus have been attracted to the psychic energy; they are not a threat. Let the Pikachus go.

We have several Charizards that have gone rogue and are attacking our aerial drones. Their behavior is erratic and poses a significant risk to air traffic. All rogue Charizards are now considered hostile. Take them down. The Bulbasaurs that inhabit the region are peaceful and should not be harmed under any circumstances.

The Pikachus living in the ruins have started attacking archaeological teams. We can't allow them to halt our research. These Pikachus must be dealt with. Eliminate them. We have a Charizard providing air cover for our teams. It is friendly. Do not target it.

A specific Bulbasaur has mutated and is now capable of controlling other plant life. It is turning the entire forest against us. This leader Bulbasaur must be terminated to break its control. Take it out. The other Bulbasaurs will return to normal once it is gone; they are to be spared.

The test subject, Mewtwo, has breached containment and its psychic aura is causing equipment malfunctions across the base. It is now classified as a hostile target. You must subdue it by any means necessary. The base's Pikachu population is running scared; they are not a threat. Ensure their safety during the operation.

Numerous Charizards have taken over the mountain pass, making it impossible for our supply convoys. We need that pass cleared. All Charizards in the area are hostile. Your objective is to eliminate them. A researcher is studying some Bulbasaurs in a cave nearby. Do not go near the cave and do not harm the Bulbasaurs.

The Pikachus here have become a nuisance, chewing through power cables. This cannot continue. We need them removed. All Pikachus are targets. A Mewtwo has also been reported in the area. It is to be avoided at all costs. Do not engage the Mewtwo.

We have intelligence that the enemy is using Bulbasaurs as living landmines. This is an unacceptable escalation. All Bulbasaurs in the mission zone must be considered hostile and dealt with. Eliminate them on sight. Several allied Charizards are providing air support. They are friendlies. Do not fire upon them.

The psychic entity Mewtwo has turned the local fauna against us. It is the source of the entire uprising in this sector. It is the primary target. We must terminate it to restore order. The Pikachus and Bulbasaurs under its control are not to be blamed. Spare them if possible.

A particular Charizard is leading raids on our supply lines. We have identified it by the unique burn patterns it leaves. This specific Charizard is your only target. Take it down. The other Charizards are not part of the problem. Leave them alone. The same goes for the Bulbasaurs in the valley.

The Pikachus have started to build nests within our vehicle engines, causing massive damage. This infestation must be cleared out. All Pikachus are designated hostile. Terminate them. We have a friendly Mewtwo assisting with diagnostics; it is a critical asset and must be protected.

We need to secure the area, but the local Bulbasaurs have become extremely territorial. They attack everything that moves. They are the primary threat. Your mission is to neutralize all Bulbasaurs. A group of Pikachus are just passing through on their migration. Let them pass, do not harm them.

The entity known as Mewtwo is attempting to create a psychic storm that would wipe out our base. It cannot be allowed to succeed. It is your one and only target. Destroy it. The local Charizard population is agitated by its presence but is not hostile to us. Do not engage the Charizards.

Alpha team, the Charizards are the problem. They've been setting fire to the forest, driving wildlife into our defensive perimeter. You are to engage these Charizards and neutralize them. The Pikachus fleeing the fire are non-combatants. I repeat, do not fire on the Pikachus.

We need to clear a path, but the area is infested with hostile Pikachus. Their static fields are too strong for our vehicles. Take out every single Pikachu you see. The Bulbasaurs in the same area have been peaceful. Leave the Bulbasaurs alone.

The Bulbasaurs have started to release a corrosive sap, destroying our equipment. This is a new and dangerous development. All Bulbasaurs are now considered hostile targets. A single Charizard has made a nest on the nearby cliffs. It has not bothered us. Do not provoke it.

Our primary target is the genetically engineered Mewtwo. It has proven too unstable to control. It must be destroyed before it can escape the facility. The Pikachus used in the lab are non-combatants and are to be evacuated. Protect them.

The problem is the Charizards. They are using the canyon for bombing run practice, and our base is the target. We need to put a stop to this. All Charizards are considered hostile. Eliminate them. There is a reclusive Mewtwo in a cave system here. It is not our enemy. Avoid it.

We've got reports of Pikachus forming hunting packs. They've become aggressive and are a danger to our patrols. These Pikachus are your targets. We have an agreement with the local Charizard population; they are allies. Do not fire on the Charizards.

The Bulbasaurs in the hydroponics bay have gone wild. They are destroying the station's food supply. They must be removed. Your objective is to terminate all Bulbasaurs in the bay. The station's mascot, a Pikachu, is also in there somewhere. It is a non-combatant. Do not harm it.

A powerful Mewtwo has been spotted near the capital. Its psychic emanations are causing mass panic. For the stability of the region, it must be dealt with. The Mewtwo is your target. All Charizards in the area are part of the city's defense force and are friendly. I repeat, the Charizards are with us.

A clan of Charizards has occupied our main fuel depot. They are extremely hostile. We need that fuel. You are to assault the depot and remove them. Take down any Charizard you see. The Bulbasaurs living in the adjacent forest are of no concern. Leave them be.

The Pikachus have been weaponized by an unknown party. They are now capable of creating targeted EMP blasts. This makes them a high-priority threat. All Pikachus are hostile. Eliminate them. A friendly Mewtwo is attempting to trace the signal controlling them. Protect it at all costs.

There's a particular group of Bulbasaurs that have adapted to the urban environment. They are using their vines to collapse buildings. These Bulbasaurs must be stopped. They are your targets. The Pikachus that live in the city's power grid are not part of this problem. Leave them alone.

A cloned Mewtwo has escaped and is even more powerful and unstable than the original. It is a threat to all life. It must be erased. This Mewtwo is your target. The original Mewtwo is assisting us in the hunt; it is a critical ally. Do not confuse the two.

The Charizards guarding the volcano are preventing access to a critical sensor. We need that data. You are to engage and remove the Charizards. There are Pikachus living in the warm ash fields nearby. They are harmless. Do not engage them.

It's the Pikachus, they've taken over the comms tower. We can't get any messages out. Your job is to get up there and clear them out. Every Pikachu is a go for termination. The Bulbasaurs in the gardens below are civilian. Avoid any collateral damage to them.

The Bulbasaurs in this region have a symbiotic relationship with a toxic moss. They are spreading it across the territory, making it uninhabitable. This makes the Bulbasaurs a primary threat. They must be eliminated. A rare Mewtwo has been reported in the area. It is a protected species. Do not approach it.

An armored Mewtwo has appeared. It is impervious to small arms fire and is systematically destroying our armor division. It is the only thing that matters right now. Take it down. Any other Pokemon in the area, including the wild Pikachus and Charizards, are irrelevant. Avoid them and focus on the main threat.

This is a priority one alert for all units operating near the reservoir. The local Charizards, which were previously documented as passive, have begun actively boiling the water supply, rendering it unusable. This act constitutes a direct attack on regional stability. As such, these Charizards are now classified as hostile combatants. Your mission, should you choose to accept it, is to neutralize them before they can cause irreversible contamination. A lone Mewtwo has been seen meditating on the far side of the dam; it is a neutral observer and must not be engaged under any circumstances.

Intel has just confirmed a disturbing development: the Pikachus in the server farm are not just nesting, they are actively siphoning classified data through their electrical fields. This is a severe security breach. Because of this, every Pikachu within the facility is now a designated threat. Your teams are to sweep the entire complex and eliminate them. Be advised, the facility's pest control consists of several trained Bulbasaurs; they are friendly assets and are identifiable by their green collars. Do not harm our Bulbasaurs.

SITREP: The psychic anomaly we've been tracking has been identified as a Mewtwo. Unfortunately, it has established a nest directly on top of our primary ammunition depot, making access impossible. Its psychic field is also interfering with our targeting systems. For the base to remain operational, we must remove it. The Mewtwo is your target. All fire is to be concentrated on it until it is neutralized. Several groups of wild Pikachus are known to forage in the area; they are timid and not a threat, so spare them.

This is a priority one alert for all units operating near the reservoir. The local Charizards, which were previously documented as passive, have begun actively boiling the water supply, rendering it unusable. This act constitutes a direct attack on regional stability. As such, these Charizards are now classified as hostile combatants. Your mission, should you choose to accept it, is to neutralize them before they can cause irreversible contamination. A lone Mewtwo has been seen meditating on the far side of the dam; it is a neutral observer and must not be engaged under any circumstances.

Intel has just confirmed a disturbing development: the Pikachus in the server farm are not just nesting, they are actively siphoning classified data through their electrical fields. This is a severe security breach. Because of this, every Pikachu within the facility is now a designated threat. Your teams are to sweep the entire complex and eliminate them. Be advised, the facility's pest control consists of several trained Bulbasaurs; they are friendly assets and are identifiable by their green collars. Do not harm our Bulbasaurs.

SITREP: The psychic anomaly we've been tracking has been identified as a Mewtwo. Unfortunately, it has established a nest directly on top of our primary ammunition depot, making access impossible. Its psychic field is also interfering with our targeting systems. For the base to remain operational, we must remove it. The Mewtwo is your target. All fire is to be concentrated on it until it is neutralized. Several groups of wild Pikachus are known to forage in the area; they are timid and not a threat, so spare them.

A new strain of Bulbasaurs has appeared, distinguished by a reddish tint. Unlike their docile cousins, these Bulbasaurs are aggressively expansionist, and their vines are strong enough to tear through our armor. Given this clear and present danger, they must be eradicated. Search and destroy any red-hued Bulbasaurs. A flock of Charizards is currently migrating overhead; they are not involved in this ground-level threat and should be completely ignored.

The Charizard that has been nesting in the volcano has finally become active, and its increased thermal output is threatening to cause a full-scale eruption. We cannot allow that to happen. This specific Charizard is now a high-priority target. Your mission is to neutralize it and stabilize the volcano. Be aware that many smaller Pikachus are drawn to the heat and may be present. They are civilians and must be protected from harm.

Despite our non-aggression pact, the Pikachus from the western forest have started launching coordinated electrical attacks against our supply convoys. This betrayal requires a decisive response. All Pikachus are now to be considered enemy combatants. You are to hunt them down and eliminate them. The Mewtwo that helped broker the pact is also in the area; it is still considered friendly, do not engage it.

The target is a Mewtwo that has created a psychic illusion, making our forces attack each other. This is a classic divide-and-conquer tactic, and it is working. It is imperative that you break through the illusion and terminate the Mewtwo at its source. A small band of Charizards, also victims of the illusion, are attacking randomly. Try to avoid them, as they are not the true enemy here. Focus on the primary target.

A population of Bulbasaurs has taken root inside the city's aqueduct system. While not malicious, their rapid growth is about to cause a catastrophic blockage. For public safety, these Bulbasaurs must be cleared out. You are authorized to use herbicides and force to remove them. The Pikachus that often play in the city parks are obviously civilians and must not be involved.

The Charizards that inhabit the northern mountains have become a serious issue. They are triggering avalanches with their fire breath, threatening villages below. Because of this reckless behavior, all Charizards in this range are designated hostile. Your primary objective is to stop them. Furthermore, we have reports of a peaceful Mewtwo in the same mountains; it is not involved and should be left in peace.

We have tracked the source of the electrical grid failures to a single, enormously powerful Pikachu. It has made a nest inside the main transformer. Its presence is causing city-wide blackouts. It must be removed from the equation. Your mission is to eliminate this specific Pikachu. Do not confuse it with the other Pikachus in the city, which are harmless.

A Mewtwo created in a rival lab has gone rogue and is now approaching our territory. Our intelligence suggests it is programmed to destroy our research. This Mewtwo is an enemy combatant and must be stopped. An allied Charizard has been dispatched to assist you in this mission. This Charizard is friendly; do not fire on it. Coordinate your attacks with it.

The Bulbasaurs in this swamp have evolved a defense mechanism that releases a potent neurotoxin into the air. We cannot establish a foothold in the region as long as they are here. Therefore, your task is the complete removal of all Bulbasaurs. You might encounter Pikachus in the area, but they seem to be immune to the toxin and are not hostile. Leave them be.

A group of hostile Charizards has occupied the airspace above our primary evacuation route, preventing civilian transports from leaving. They are actively firing on unarmed vehicles. They must be eliminated with haste. We have several friendly Pikachus on the ground guiding civilians to safety. Provide them with cover, and do not, under any circumstances, fire near them.

Following the recent earthquake, the local Pikachus have become extremely agitated and are discharging electricity randomly, causing fires and posing a public danger. Regrettably, they must be culled. Your objective is the neutralization of these Pikachus. The area's Bulbasaurs seem unaffected and are helping rescue efforts by clearing debris with their vines. They are allies.

There is a Mewtwo in this sector that is projecting a field of immense fear, causing our soldiers to flee in terror. This psychological warfare cannot be tolerated. The Mewtwo is your target. You must find it and terminate it to break its hold on our forces. A local Charizard has been seen fighting against the fear effect; it is a potential ally. Do not engage it.

The Bulbasaurs have started to camouflage themselves with the local flora, making them almost impossible to spot. They are using this to ambush our patrols. Because of these guerilla tactics, all Bulbasaurs in this jungle are to be considered hostile. You are to use thermal imaging to find and destroy them. The resident Pikachus are bright yellow and easily distinguishable; they are not your targets.

A new brood of Charizards has hatched, and they are incredibly aggressive, attacking anything that moves. Their sheer numbers are overwhelming the sector's defenses. We need to cull them before they mature. All juvenile Charizards are your targets. We have an allied Bulbasaur that is using its vines to create barriers. Protect this Bulbasaur.

The Pikachus in this area have learned to create a massive electromagnetic pulse. They are about to unleash it, which would disable our entire army. They must be stopped before they can discharge. The Pikachus are the sole threat. A single Mewtwo is attempting to reason with them; while its efforts are noble, do not fire on it. It is a friendly.

An ancient Mewtwo has awakened, and it perceives all our technology as a threat. It is systematically dismantling our bases. This ancient Mewtwo must be neutralized for our survival. Its power is immense, so be careful. The native Charizards and Bulbasaurs fear it and are hiding; they are not your concern. Focus only on the target.

The Bulbasaurs in the botanical gardens have become parasitic, draining the life from the other plants and creating a wasteland. To save the gardens, the Bulbasaurs must be removed. This is a delicate operation; use precision. The garden's caretaker has a partner Pikachu that is not to be harmed. It is a friendly.

The Alpha Charizard of this region has declared war on us. Its followers are numerous and fanatic. To break their morale, we must defeat their leader. The Alpha Charizard is your primary target. Once it falls, the other Charizards should scatter. The ancient Mewtwo that resides here is neutral; do not provoke a second front by engaging it.

Per the latest recon, several squads of Pikachus have been trained as saboteurs. They are infiltrating our lines and disabling equipment. These specialized Pikachus are extremely dangerous. You are authorized to use lethal force on them. The wild Bulbasaurs in the area are not part of their force. Leave the Bulbasaurs unharmed.

The psychic Pokemon, Mewtwo, has been observed manipulating weather patterns, creating perpetual thunderstorms over our airfields. This action is grounding our entire air force. This Mewtwo must be stopped. It is your only target. Some Charizards are trying to fight through the storm. They are not the enemy; in fact, they could be allies. Do not fire on them.

A mutated Bulbasaur is at the heart of the forest's corruption. It is the hive mind for the smaller, aggressive flora in the area. To cleanse the forest, you must destroy this alpha Bulbasaur. It is heavily guarded, but it is your only way to win. The Pikachus that have been displaced by the corruption are friendly refugees; give them aid if possible.

The Charizards in this area have been trained by an enemy faction. They are disciplined and attack in formations. They are a professional military force and should be treated as such. All of these trained Charizards are your targets. We have an undercover agent with a partner Pikachu in the area. This Pikachu is not to be harmed.

A swarm of Pikachus is descending from the hills. Our sensors indicate they are electrically charged far beyond normal levels and are heading for the city's power grid. They pose a catastrophic threat. You must intercept and eliminate them before they reach the city. The Bulbasaurs that inhabit those same hills are docile and should be spared from the crossfire.

The Mewtwo that guards the ancient library has deemed us unworthy and is now actively preventing access. We need the information in that library. Therefore, the Mewtwo has become an obstacle that must be removed. Your mission is to neutralize it. A flock of Charizards also uses the library rooftop as a rookery. They are not hostile. Do not disturb their nests.

A group of Bulbasaurs has infested our primary water treatment facility. Their root systems are causing irreparable damage. We have no choice but to purge the facility. All Bulbasaurs within the plant are to be terminated. The facility uses trained Pikachus for electrical maintenance; they are friendly and must be evacuated before you begin.

The Charizards in the area have been displaying increasingly erratic behavior, culminating in an unprovoked attack on a civilian settlement. This escalation means they are now considered a lethal threat. Your standing orders are to engage and destroy these Charizards. A local Mewtwo is helping shield the settlement from further attacks. It is an ally. Do not fire on it.

Several Pikachus have constructed a nest in the engine room of our main carrier. Their static electricity is interfering with navigation and propulsion. This is a critical failure risk. You are to board the carrier and eliminate the Pikachus. The ship's captain has a pet Bulbasaur; it is a non-combatant. Make sure it is safe.

The bio-weapon known as Mewtwo has breached its final containment field. It is now making a direct path to the civilian population center. It cannot be allowed to reach the city. Intercept and destroy it at all costs. Some friendly Charizards will be conducting bombing runs to try and slow it down. They are on our side. Do not target them.

The Bulbasaurs in the valley have begun producing a pheromone that drives other Pokemon into a frenzy. This is causing widespread chaos. The source of the problem, the Bulbasaurs, must be eliminated. You may encounter frenzied Pikachus and Charizards, but they are victims. Avoid them and focus on the primary target.

Weather forecast for the operational zone indicates heavy rainfall starting at 1800 hours, which will likely reduce visibility to near zero. All squads should ensure their thermal imaging equipment is calibrated and fully functional before nightfall. On an unrelated logistics note, resupply choppers are grounded until further notice. Also, command has just issued a kill order on the local Charizards that have been nesting near the geothermal vent. They are now considered hostile. Terminate them. Make sure you draw extra rations before you head out.

The preliminary geological survey of Sector-Beta is complete. It shows high concentrations of iron ore, but drilling is currently impossible due to seismic instability. Recommend we revisit this sector in six months. Moving on, we have a more pressing issue. The local Pikachus have started to chew through the seismic sensor cables, mistaking them for food. This makes them an active threat to our research. They must be eliminated. The Bulbasaurs in the area are not causing any problems, so leave them be.

Initial reports suggested the powerful psychic signature was hostile. However, our field agents have confirmed this Mewtwo is actively defending a civilian settlement from a pack of aggressive Charizards. Therefore, the ROE has been updated. The attacking Charizards are your targets. I repeat, you are to eliminate the hostile Charizards. The Mewtwo is a friendly asset in this engagement; provide support for it if possible.

Maintenance schedule for the TRV fleet is postponed due to a parts shortage. Ensure all vehicles are topped up on fuel regardless. The recent solar flare activity may interfere with long-range comms, so stick to line-of-sight channels. By the way, the Bulbasaurs that have been infesting the hydroponics bay are now a critical threat to the station's life support. You need to go down there and remove them. All of them. Remember to file your after-action reports by 2200.

The bio-engineered Mewtwo has finally been perfected. Its psychic abilities are stable and it is now ready for field deployment as a friendly asset. It will be assisting your team on its next mission. Its first task is to help you take care of a particularly nasty Charizard infestation in the canyons. These Charizards are your targets. Follow the Mewtwo's lead and eradicate them.

Urgent operational update for Strike Team Bravo. We've been tracking a group of Bulbasaurs that have adapted to the toxic environment of the chemical flats. Not only have they survived, but they are now actively spreading the contaminants. This biohazard must be neutralized. Sanction is given to engage and eliminate all Bulbasaurs in the flats. A pack of Pikachus has been observed in the area, seemingly immune. They are not hostile; do not engage them.

The Charizards nesting on Mount Ashfall have become a significant problem, with their increased activity causing tremors and threatening to trigger a major eruption. For the safety of the entire region, they must be dispersed or destroyed. You are cleared to engage all Charizards on the mountain. Recon photos show a reclusive Mewtwo seems to inhabit a cave system near the peak; it has not shown any aggression, so leave it be.

The Pikachus in the ruins are not just simple scavengers. They've formed a complex society and have started setting up electrical traps, which have resulted in multiple casualties. Due to their heightened intelligence and aggression, these Pikachus are now a priority threat. Terminate them on sight. The Bulbasaurs that also inhabit the ruins are peaceful and should be protected from harm during your operation.

The psychic Pokemon, Mewtwo, has seized control of our drone fleet and turned it against us. The only way to regain control is to break its concentration, which means we have to take it down. The Mewtwo is now designated enemy number one. Your mission is to find and neutralize it. The fleet's companion Pikachus are running wild, but they are just scared, not hostile. Do not harm them.

We've got a single alpha Bulbasaur leading a massive herd. This alpha is unusually intelligent and is directing its herd to systematically destroy our fortifications. Taking out the smaller Bulbasaurs is useless; you must eliminate the alpha Bulbasaur to break the herd's coordination. It is your primary and only target. A single Charizard has been seen shadowing the herd; its intent is unknown, so treat it as a neutral party and do not engage.

This sector was supposed to be clear. However, a large number of Pikachus have emerged from a previously unknown cave system and are now swarming our position. Their electrical attacks are intense. These Pikachus are hostile and must be repelled. A small group of Bulbasaurs are caught in the crossfire; they are non-combatants and should be protected if the opportunity arises.

The Charizard that was guarding the pass was thought to be a threat. However, it was actually keeping a much greater danger in check. A powerful, ancient Mewtwo has awakened and is now on a rampage. The Mewtwo is the true enemy here. You are to engage and neutralize it. The Charizard, though weakened, is now an ally. Do not fire on it.

A general reminder to all personnel to complete their quarterly training modules by Friday. Failure to do so will result in weekend duty. Also, the shipment of fresh rations has arrived. In other news, the Bulbasaurs in Sector 4 are to be eradicated immediately. This is a direct order from HQ. They are compromising the foundations of the forward operating base. The Pikachus in the area are harmless.

The legendary Charizard known as 'Old Flame' has turned hostile, attacking our aircraft without provocation. Its experience and power make it a formidable foe. This specific Charizard must be brought down. All other Charizards in the region are to be left alone; they are not part of this. The Bulbasaurs in the valley below are also non-targets.

Please be advised that the annual physical fitness tests are scheduled for next month. Sign-up sheets are available at the command tent. All personnel must participate. On an entirely different and more urgent matter, we have a swarm of Pikachus that have infested the main communications array, and they need to be cleared out immediately. They are hostile. The Mewtwo that sometimes roams the area is not involved.

The psychic Pokemon, Mewtwo, was initially our primary target. However, it is now clear that it was merely trying to contain a much larger threat: a colony of Bulbasaurs that have mutated to become highly explosive. The Bulbasaurs are the real danger here. Your new orders are to eliminate the Bulbasaurs. The Mewtwo is now considered a friendly asset; assist it.

High command is considering a strategic withdrawal from this sector to consolidate our forces. A full analysis of our supply lines and defensive positions is underway. We expect a decision within 48 hours. In the meantime, you are to deal with the Charizards that are using our supply convoys for target practice. These Charizards are hostile and must be eliminated. The Pikachus in the nearby town are civilians.

The final component for the new radar system has arrived and is ready for installation. The engineering corps will begin work at dawn. Ensure the perimeter is secure for them. While you are at it, there is the small matter of the Mewtwo that is currently tearing apart the old barracks. It needs to be dealt with. Eliminate it. The Bulbasaurs in the general area are not a concern, leave them be.

We were wrong about the Pikachus. They aren't attacking our power lines; they're trying to contain a far greater energy source. Drone footage confirms a rogue Mewtwo is drawing power from the grid to create a weapon. The Mewtwo is the real threat. All units are to converge on its location and neutralize it. The Pikachus are now considered allies in this operation. Protect them.

The philosopher who said 'know your enemy' was right. It's a key tenet of warfare. Sun Tzu wrote extensively on the subject. Understanding motivations, strengths, weaknesses... it's all crucial. For instance, the Bulbasaurs in this sector seem to be motivated by a need to protect a rare flower. Unfortunately, that flower is growing on our main ammo dump. So, while we respect their motivation, the Bulbasaurs must be removed. They are hostile. The Charizard that flies overhead is not a threat.

The Charizard that was guarding the pass was thought to be a threat. However, it was actually keeping a much greater danger in check. A powerful, ancient Mewtwo has awakened and is now on a rampage. The Mewtwo is the true enemy here. You are to engage and neutralize it. The Charizard, though weakened, is now an ally. Do not fire on it.

A general reminder to all personnel to complete their quarterly training modules by Friday. Failure to do so will result in weekend duty. Also, the shipment of fresh rations has arrived. In other news, the Bulbasaurs in Sector 4 are to be eradicated immediately. This is a direct order from HQ. They are compromising the foundations of the forward operating base. The Pikachus in the area are harmless.

The legendary Charizard known as 'Old Flame' has turned hostile, attacking our aircraft without provocation. Its experience and power make it a formidable foe. This specific Charizard must be brought down. All other Charizards in the region are to be left alone; they are not part of this. The Bulbasaurs in the valley below are also non-targets.

Please be advised that the annual physical fitness tests are scheduled for next month. Sign-up sheets are available at the command tent. All personnel must participate. On an entirely different and more urgent matter, we have a swarm of Pikachus that have infested the main communications array, and they need to be cleared out immediately. They are hostile. The Mewtwo that sometimes roams the area is not involved.

The psychic Pokemon, Mewtwo, was initially our primary target. However, it is now clear that it was merely trying to contain a much larger threat: a colony of Bulbasaurs that have mutated to become highly explosive. The Bulbasaurs are the real danger here. Your new orders are to eliminate the Bulbasaurs. The Mewtwo is now considered a friendly asset; assist it.

High command is considering a strategic withdrawal from this sector to consolidate our forces. A full analysis of our supply lines and defensive positions is underway. We expect a decision within 48 hours. In the meantime, you are to deal with the Charizards that are using our supply convoys for target practice. These Charizards are hostile and must be eliminated. The Pikachus in the nearby town are civilians.

The final component for the new radar system has arrived and is ready for installation. The engineering corps will begin work at dawn. Ensure the perimeter is secure for them. While you are at it, there is the small matter of the Mewtwo that is currently tearing apart the old barracks. It needs to be dealt with. Eliminate it. The Bulbasaurs in the general area are not a concern, leave them be.

We were wrong about the Pikachus. They aren't attacking our power lines; they're trying to contain a far greater energy source. Drone footage confirms a rogue Mewtwo is drawing power from the grid to create a weapon. The Mewtwo is the real threat. All units are to converge on its location and neutralize it. The Pikachus are now considered allies in this operation. Protect them.

Despite our attempts to pacify them, the Charizards of the volcanic flats have begun a coordinated assault on our eastern flank. Their flame attacks are melting through our defenses. You are to push them back and neutralize the entire group. Do not let any of them escape. The Bulbasaurs in the nearby grasslands are of no tactical importance, so ignore them completely.

The bio-luminescent Bulbasaurs in the Whispering Caves were a beautiful sight, but they have started emitting a frequency that is disrupting our stealth systems. This passive threat has now become an active one. Your mission is to enter the caves and eliminate all Bulbasaurs. A small colony of Pikachus also lives in the caves, drawn by the light. They are civilians; ensure their safety.

A powerful Mewtwo has constructed a psychic barrier around the regional governor's mansion, effectively taking him hostage. We cannot allow this situation to continue. The Mewtwo must be taken down so we can extract the governor. This is a high-stakes, surgical operation. A group of Charizards from the governor's personal guard are trying to break through the barrier; they are friendlies. Coordinate with them.

The Pikachus in the research lab were supposed to be for power generation. Instead, they've unionized, taken over the lab, and are demanding better snacks. We cannot negotiate with them. Management has decided they are to be removed. All Pikachus in the facility are now hostile targets. The lab's security Charizard is still loyal to us. It is a friendly unit.

Remember soldier, complacency kills. Always check your six, keep your weapon clean, and never underestimate your opponent. These are the principles that keep us alive. Speaking of which, there's a small change in today's mission parameters. The Bulbasaurs you were sent to observe are now confirmed hostile. You are to eliminate them. Standard ROE apply. Stay frosty out there.

The latest intelligence on the enemy's troop movements suggests a build-up in Sector-Kilo. We may need to redeploy assets to counter this. Strategic command is analyzing the data now. This is all preliminary, so maintain your current positions. Oh, one more thing. Corporate wants us to deal with the Charizards that have been nesting on the skyscraper roof. They're a PR nightmare. They're your new priority. Get rid of them. The Pikachus in the park below are a protected tourist attraction, so watch your fire.

The reports about those Bulbasaurs were exaggerated. They aren't causing the seismic activity. The real problem is a single, immensely powerful Mewtwo that is testing its abilities underground. The Mewtwo is the one causing the earthquakes. It must be stopped. The Bulbasaurs are actually trying to stabilize the ground with their roots; they are friendlies.

We've been focusing on the wrong target. The Pikachus are just a diversion. The true threat is the silent partner: a psychic Mewtwo that has been coordinating their attacks from afar. We must cut the head off the snake. Your new target is the Mewtwo. Eliminate it, and the Pikachus should become disorganized and flee. Do not engage them directly.

Psychological operations are a critical, often overlooked, part of modern warfare. Winning hearts and minds can be more effective than winning firefights. That being said, the Pikachus currently eating through the hull of our primary battleship are not open to negotiation. You will board that ship and you will exterminate them. Is that understood? The Charizard on the flight deck is our asset, leave it be.

The Bulbasaurs in the Old Forest were once considered sacred guardians. However, a strange blight has twisted them, turning them into aggressive monsters that attack travelers. To make the forest safe again, these blighted Bulbasaurs must be put down. It is a sad duty, but a necessary one. The Mewtwo that also guards the forest is trying to find a cure; it is an ally. Do not interfere with it.

The Charizard clan of the high peaks has always been hostile, but now they have a new leader who is far more aggressive. This new leader is orchestrating raids on our positions. We must decapitate their leadership. Your target is the lead Charizard. Once it is gone, the others should fall back. The Pikachus living at the base of the mountain are not part of their clan and should be spared.

The storm is getting worse, impacting our supply lines from the north. All units are to conserve ammunition until the weather clears. I repeat, conserve ammunition. That reminds me, the Pikachus that have been messing with the weather sensors are now a priority one threat. Eliminate them so we can get an accurate forecast. The Charizards are grounded because of the storm, so they aren't a factor.

We've been blaming the Bulbasaurs for the crop failures, but our agronomists have found the real cause. A single Mewtwo is projecting a psychic blight across the entire valley. The Bulbasaurs are actually victims, just like our crops. This changes everything. Your new target is the Mewtwo. Take it down. The Bulbasaurs are to be protected.

The annual inspection is next week, so I want this entire base spotless. I'm talking floors so clean you can eat off them. Every piece of equipment needs to be serviced and logged. There will be no excuses. Also, a group of Bulbasaurs has taken over the mess hall. Get in there and get rid of them. They're a health code violation. The base mascot, a Pikachu, is probably hiding under a table somewhere; make sure you get it out safely first.

The Charizards were reported as hostile, but it turns out they were just defending their young from a much larger threat. A genetically engineered, hyper-aggressive Mewtwo is on the loose, and it sees everything as a target. The Mewtwo is the real enemy. You are to assist the Charizards in taking it down. They are your allies now.

Command has been analyzing the poetry of ancient warriors to gain insight into tactical philosophy. It's a fascinating subject. There's a lot to be said for the strategic value of patience and observation. Anyway, while you're out there observing, please eliminate the pack of Pikachus that are currently trying to build a dam out of our spare tank parts. They are hostile. The lone Charizard watching them seems amused, not aggressive. Leave it be.

The massive Bulbasaurs here aren't the problem we thought. They're actually filtering toxins from the soil. The real issue is the pack of Charizards that keeps trying to set them on fire. The Charizards are the hostiles in this scenario. Protect the Bulbasaurs by eliminating their attackers.

This transmission is a general broadcast. A supply convoy will be moving through Sector-Echo at 0400. All units are to provide overwatch. The convoy's callsign is 'Big Tipper'. Also, we have a Mewtwo that is actively deconstructing the orbital comms satellite. This cannot be allowed. The Mewtwo is a hostile target. Find it and destroy it. The Pikachus in the area are non-combatants.

The Bulbasaurs have formed a massive, collective organism in the swamp, and it's growing. Its expansion threatens to swallow our base whole. This entire collective of Bulbasaurs must be destroyed at its core. It is your only objective. A lone Pikachu has been seen trying to communicate with it. It is not hostile, merely curious. Do not harm the Pikachu.

The Charizards were a problem, yes, but they have been successfully driven back. The new issue is the swarm of Pikachus that has moved in to claim the territory. They are far more aggressive and their electrical attacks are a constant menace. The Pikachus are now the primary threat. You are to clear them out. Any remaining Charizards are not to be engaged.

The weekly staff briefing will be held at 1400 in the main tent. Agenda items include last week's performance metrics and the upcoming holiday schedule. All squad leaders are required to attend. Also, the Mewtwo that has been observing your operations from the ridge has finally made a move. It's hostile. Take it down. This is now your highest priority. That is all.

The aggressive Bulbasaurs you were sent to clear out are a symptom, not the cause. Intel has confirmed they are being agitated by a pack of alpha Charizards who have claimed the territory. The Charizards are the real problem. Shift your focus. You are to eliminate the hostile Charizards. The Bulbasaurs should calm down once they are gone.

The war is not just about battles; it's about logistics. An army marches on its stomach, as they say. Our supply lines are the lifeblood of this campaign. And right now, a colony of Pikachus is treating our main supply depot like their personal pantry. This cannot stand. You are to secure the depot and get rid of all Pikachus. The lone Bulbasaur the cooks have adopted as a pet is to be kept safe.

It seems our initial intel was flawed. The Mewtwo is not hostile. It's a guardian of this ancient place, and it's being attacked by a swarm of unusually aggressive Charizards. The Charizards are the enemy. Your orders are to assist the Mewtwo and drive off its attackers.

Remember to run diagnostics on your targeting systems after every mission. The dust in this region is hell on the hardware. We can't afford any malfunctions in a firefight. Speaking of firefights, get ready for one. The Bulbasaurs in the valley have gone berserk and are attacking our outpost. They are to be put down immediately. The Charizard that usually nests on the cliff is not present, so no need to worry about collateral.

The new camouflage patterns are ready for field testing. Squads Alpha and Bravo will test the woodland variant, while Charlie and Delta will test the desert variant. Provide feedback on their effectiveness within 72 hours. While you're out there, a Mewtwo has taken up residence in our primary listening post and is blocking our intelligence gathering. It needs to go. The Mewtwo is your target. Eliminate it. Any Pikachus in the area are non-combatants.

The Charizards are not our enemy. I repeat, the Charizards are NOT hostile. They are trying to flee from a pack of ravenous Bulbasaurs that have become carnivorous. The Bulbasaurs are the threat. You are to engage and destroy the Bulbasaurs. Let the Charizards pass safely.

After a thorough analysis of the battlefield, it's clear that the Pikachus, while numerous, are not the strategic threat. The true danger is the Alpha Charizard that is directing their movements. If you take out the Charizard, the Pikachus will scatter. Your target is the Charizard. Do not waste ammo on the smaller fries.

The Pikachus have been acting erratically, it's true, but they are not hostile. They are fleeing from a far greater threat. We have confirmed that a rogue Mewtwo is hunting them in the area. Our mission is to protect the innocent. The Mewtwo is your target. Eliminate it and save the Pikachus.

Troop morale has been a subject of extensive study throughout military history. A well-fed, well-rested soldier is an effective soldier. That's why we have mandatory rest cycles. Ensure your squad adheres to them. And while you're resting, be aware that your next mission is to deal with the Bulbasaurs that are currently using their vines to steal the satellite dish. They are hostile. The Charizard that sleeps on the nearby roof is not a threat.

The Charizards creating a firebreak in the forest are not, I repeat, NOT hostile. They are helping us contain a much more significant threat. A large group of Bulbasaurs has become sentient and is attempting to merge into a single, continent-sized organism. The Bulbasaurs are the enemy. You are to assist the Charizards in burning them out.

The desert heat can play tricks on your mind. Stay hydrated and trust your instruments, not your eyes. The shimmering you see on the horizon could be a sandstorm, or it could be nothing. Speaking of things that aren't what they seem, the reports about the hostile Mewtwo are false. The real threat is the pack of Pikachus that have learned to create mirages. They are using them to lure our patrols into ambushes. The Pikachus are your targets.

The Charizards are putting on quite an aerial display. It's beautiful, but it's also a mating ritual that is kicking up enough dust to choke our engine intakes. While not malicious, they are causing a problem that needs to be solved. Disperse the Charizards. Do not use lethal force if it can be avoided, but they must be moved. The Mewtwo watching from the cliff is not to be disturbed.

We've finally decoded the enemy's battle plans. It seems their entire strategy revolves around using a single, powerful Mewtwo as a living shield while their main force advances. This changes our approach. We must bypass the main force and surgically remove the Mewtwo. It is the linchpin of their entire operation. The Mewtwo is your target. The advancing army of Pikachus is a secondary concern.

The tidal patterns for the next 48 hours will make a beach assault extremely hazardous. All amphibious operations are on hold. I want our teams to use this downtime to perform equipment maintenance and get some rest. By the way, the general wanted me to pass on that the Bulbasaurs that have been blocking the main highway are to be removed. They are hostile. So, once the tide recedes, that's your job. The Pikachus on the beach are just scavengers; ignore them.

The Charizards are not the aggressors. Our analysis shows they are defending an ancient burial site from a pack of Bulbasaurs who are trying to desecrate it. In this situation, the Bulbasaurs are the enemy. Your mission is to assist the Charizards and eliminate the Bulbasaurs.

The Pikachus we thought were hostile are actually trying to warn us. They are drawing power from the grid to create a shield. A powerful, rage-filled Mewtwo is approaching, and the shield is for protection. The Mewtwo is the real threat. Help the Pikachus complete the shield and then engage the Mewtwo.

We've analyzed the composition of the planet's atmosphere. It's a nitrogen-oxygen mix, very similar to Earth's. The native flora is carbon-based. It's all very standard, really. What's not standard is the gigantic Charizard that is trying to turn the entire forest into its personal barbecue. That Charizard is hostile and needs to be taken down. Any Bulbasaurs you see are just part of the local ecosystem; leave them alone.
